intro: Bridelia atroviridis, commonly known as black-veined bridelia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with dark green veins and small, clustered yellow flowers. Bridelia atroviridis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage.
